rtega_mnemonic:
聳聳RS
耸耸		urge on, rise up, stir, excite, to raise up, lofty
  • many people 人人 stop 龰 sitting still and listening 耳 to stand up and applaud before going out 彳 and telling everybody who wants to hear 耳 how good the performance was
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 耸)
Pictophonetic: 從 indicates the sound; 耳 (ear) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
聳立 [ sǒng lì ]: to stand tall; to tower aloft
聳肩 [ sǒng jiān ]: to shrug one's shoulders
聳人聽聞 [ sǒng rén tīng wén ]: to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people

heisig_chinese_memo: You're asking me which way to go?  *shrug*  I don't know. Listen to the other people with your ears and follow them.
Ru_trainchinese: sǒng: (глаг) выситься, возвышаться; тревожить, пугать; пожимать (плечами)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: obey (從) your ear (耳) to tower
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The factory boss yells orders at his workers but when the assembly line can't hear him they just shrug their shoulders and continue working.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " ear ", " from " sound. " Suowen " is made " 𢕈 ", from " ear ", " from " to save sound. The original meaning is deafness. "Said the text": "𢕈, born and deaf, said shrug. From the ear, from the province sound." And "Dialect. "Sixth": "Ting, 叁, deaf. [...] Born to be deaf, Chen, Chu, Jianghuai is said to be towering. Between Jing and Yang, and between the mountains and the east and west of the deaf people are called towering." Such as Ma Rong in the Eastern Han Dynasty, "Guangcheng Ode 〉: "Ziye listened to the ears, dizzy from Zhu."

" Sheng " means encouragement and advocacy. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Sixth Year of Zhaogong": "Fear of the future, so loyal to teach, to act with loyalty, to teach with work, to make peace." Wang Niansun said: "To act with sway is to reward and persuade him for good deeds." Another example is "Mandarin. "Chu Yushang": "Teach the "Spring and Autumn", and use precepts to persuade them." Wei Zhao's note: "Short, reward."

" Sheng " means panic and fear. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "Fourteenth Year of Cheng Gong": "Doctors are all horrified when they hear it." "Han Feizi. On the internal reserve. "Seven Skills": "So all the officials shuddered, thinking that the king was a god."

" Song " also said stands, raised. Such as "Liu Zi New Theory. "Special Good": "The towering rock and the rock, the place where the fungus congeals the scum, the people are trembling." "Song Shu. "Liu Muzhi Biography": "Since you reach a mountain, the peaks and ridges are beautiful, the trees are dense, and the meaning is joyful." Also used as a verb to express upward and lift. For example, in Southern Song Yang Wanli's "Cold Food and Rain": "Shuangyan rushed to the curtain to report smoking ban, and shrugged poems to evoke shocking day dreams."
humanum_short_description_en: From " ear ", " from " sound. The original meaning is deafness.
humanum_full_description:
從「耳」，「從」聲。《說文》作「𢕈」，從「耳」，「從」省聲。本義是耳聾。《說文》：「𢕈，生而聾曰聳。从耳，從省聲。」又《方言．第六》：「聳、䏁，聾也。[……]生而聾，陳楚江淮之間謂之聳。荊揚之間及山之東西雙聾者謂之聳。」如東漢馬融〈廣成頌〉：「子野聽聳，離朱目眩。」

　　「聳」表示鼓勵、崇尚。如《左傳．昭公六年》：「懼其未也，故誨之以忠，聳之以行，教之以務，使之以和。」王念孫曰：「聳之以行，謂舉善行以奬勸之。」又如《國語．楚語上》：「教之《春秋》，而為之聳善而抑惡焉，以戒勸其心。」韋昭注：「聳，奬也。」

　　「聳」表示驚恐、恐懼。如《左傳．成公十四年》：「大夫聞之，無不聳懼。」《韓非子．內儲說上．七術》：「於是吏皆聳懼，以為君神明也。」

　　「聳」也表示矗立、高起。如《劉子新論．殊好》：「聳石巉巖，輪菌糺結猨狖之所便也，人上而慄。」《宋書．劉穆之傳》：「既而至一山，峰崿聳秀，林樹繁密，意甚悅之。」又作動詞，表示向上抬、舉。如南宋楊萬里〈寒食雨作〉：「雙燕衝簾報禁煙，喚驚晝夢聳詩肩。」

Pinyin: sǒng
English Definition: to excite; to raise up; to shrug; high; lofty; towering

Pictophonetic: 從 indicates the sound; 耳 (ear) conveys the meaning.

從「 耳 」，「 從 」聲。《說文》作「 𢕈 」，從「 耳 」，「 從 」省聲。本義是耳聾。《說文》：「𢕈，生而聾曰聳。从耳，從省聲。」又《方言．第六》：「聳、䏁，聾也。[……]生而聾，陳楚江淮之間謂之聳。荊揚之間及山之東西雙聾者謂之聳。」如東漢馬融〈廣成頌〉：「子野聽聳，離朱目眩。」 「 聳 」表示鼓勵、崇尚。如《左傳．昭公六年》：「懼其未也，故誨之以忠，聳之以行，教之以務，使之以和。」王念孫曰：「聳之以行，謂舉善行以奬勸之。」又如《國語．楚語上》：「教之《春秋》，而為之聳善而抑惡焉，以戒勸其心。」韋昭注：「聳，奬也。」 「 聳 」表示驚恐、恐懼。如《左傳．成公十四年》：「大夫聞之，無不聳懼。」《韓非子．內儲說上．七術》：「於是吏皆聳懼，以為君神明也。」 「 聳 」也表示矗立、高起。如《劉子新論．殊好》：「聳石巉巖，輪菌糺結猨狖之所便也，人上而慄。」《宋書．劉穆之傳》：「既而至一山，峰崿聳秀，林樹繁密，意甚悅之。」又作動詞，表示向上抬、舉。如南宋楊萬里〈寒食雨作〉：「雙燕衝簾報禁煙，喚驚晝夢聳詩肩。」

Liushutong characters (3)

聳字的基本解释

聳
sǒng
见“耸”。

聳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sǒng］
［《廣韻》息拱切，上腫，心。］
“耸1”的繁体字。
(1)耳聋。
(2)高起；矗立；生长。
(3)往上跳；向上动。
(4)持物上下振动或移动。亦指推动。
(5)表露或振作。
(6)劝勉，奖励。
(7)怂恿。
(8)通“悚”。恐惧；惊动。
(9)通“竦”。恭敬；肃敬。
(10)通“竦”。企立。参见“聳企”、“聳觀”。

聳字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【耳字部】　聳； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页969第20
【廣韻】息拱切【集韻】筍勇切【韻會】荀勇切【正韻】息勇切，?音竦。【揚子·方言】聳，聾也。生而聾，陳楚江淮之閒謂之聳。【註】言無所聞，常聳耳也。　又高也。【韓愈·會合聯句】劒心知未死，詩思猶孤聳。　又【揚子·方言】聳，欲也。荆吳之閒曰聳。自關而西，秦晉之閒相勸曰聳。　又【揚子·方言】聳，悚也。【註】謂警聳也。【左傳·成十四年】大夫聞之，無不聳懼。【楚語】昔殷武丁，能聳其德。【註】聳，敬也。　又【集韻】雙講切，音。義同。

聳字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
聳字的起名意思

暂无。

towering
Basic explanation of words
towering
sǒng
See "Sheng".
towering
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［sǒng］
["Guangyun" has a swollen upper part and a heart. ]
The traditional characters for "Sheng 1".
(1) Deafness.
(2) Raise; stand up; grow.
(3) Jump up; move up.
(4) The holding object vibrates or moves up and down. Also refers to push.
(5) Reveal or cheer up.
(6) Encourage and reward.
(7) Encouragement.
(8) Through "horror". Fear; alarm.
(9) Through "snap". Respectful; respectful.
(10) Through "snake". Entrepreneurship. See "Surprise Enterprise", "Surprise View".
towering
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not concentrated] [Ear Word Department] 　怀; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Pages: Page 969 No. 20
[Guang Yun] Xi Gong cut [Ji Yun] Bamboo shoots cut courageously [Yun Hui] Xun Yong cut [Zheng Yun] Breath courageous cut,? Sound beating. [Yangtze Dialect] Shouting, deaf. Born to be deaf, Chen Chu and Jianghuai's leisure is called sacred. [Note] Words are unheard, often shrugging.　It's tall. [Han Yu·Combined Sentence] I know my heart is not dead, my poetry is still lonely.　[Yangtze Dialect] shrugs, desires too. Jing Wu Zhixian said shruggingly. From the Guan to the west, Qin and Jin’s Xianxiang persuades him to shrug.　[Yangtze Dialect] Shrugging, terrifying. [Note] That is also the alarm. [Zuo Zhuan·14 years of adulthood] When the doctor heard it, they were all horrified. [Chu language] Xiyin Wuding, can stun its virtues. [Note] Shrug, Jing Ye.　[Jiyun] Double talk and cut, sound . The same meaning.
